body:
A: can cause problems if there is a table `name` (in general case any table with name similar to column name).
B: rails threat this api in the same way as A. So similar probem
C: problem with table name `not`, but it seems more reliable - as it cause side effects only when there is table with name `not`.
D: seems have no problems.



```
1.9.3p125 :076 >   puts User.where("name.not" => nil).to_sql
SELECT "users".* FROM "users"  WHERE "name"."not" IS NULL
 => nil 
1.9.3p125 :077 > puts User.where(:name => {:not => nil}).to_sql
SELECT "users".* FROM "users"  WHERE "name"."not" IS NULL
 => nil 
1.9.3p125 :078 > puts User.where(:not => {:name => nil}).to_sql
SELECT "users".* FROM "users"  WHERE "not"."name" IS NULL
 => nil 
1.9.3p125 :079 > puts User.where(:not, :name => nil).to_sql
SELECT "users".* FROM "users"  WHERE ('not')
 => nil
